blog.name: dizzyfingers18
blog.title: the op is in angst mode

summary:
In the battlefield, bronn has sustained a near fatal wound...
Bronn: it's my wish that before i die, i want to see you saying...
body:
In the battlefield, bronn has sustained a near fatal wound…

Bronn: it’s my wish that before i die, i want to see you saying ‘fuck’.

Pod: i-i can’t.

Bronn: i’m gonna count to three, and you’re gonna say it.

Bronn: one… two… three…

Pod: …fuck.

Bronn: ENJOY HELL, SWAMP MOUTH!

summary: Do you have any idea if Tormund character will survive throughout season 8?
question: Do you have any idea if Tormund character will survive throughout season 8?
answer:
Yes, he will. He’s a big fan fav, but still a minor character, whose fate has no impact on the great endgame. It’ll be very easy for D&D to keep him alive for fan service. And after reading this and this, I’m 100% sure they will.

Btw, Kristofer was in London on Friday and is going to be there next Friday. And WotW are saying the cast is gathering in Belfast for a party + filming. So I’m pretty sure it’s where Kris is going to spend this week.

We post original content & check the public tag #gameofthronesdaily This is NOT a spoiler free blog.

blog.name: thousandeyesand-one
blog.title: TARGARYEN LOYALIST!
blog.description:
Summi, 20's, asoiaf Watsonian,
❄ J O N E R Y S 🔥
|Gendrya|
Rhaegar Targaryen,
Lyanna Stark,
Daenerys Targaryen,
Jon Snow/Aegon Targaryen,
Arya Stark,
Bran Stark are the only characters I care about!
I reblog marvel & stranger things too!
Just a petite gal from Chicago trying to read all the books she can.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary:
•I do think they are important. Very Important.
•Daenerys was the first Targaryen in centuries to successfully hatch dragon eggs...
body:
Why Jon & Daenerys Are Pretty Interesting And Important To ASOIAF as pointed by a J0nsa Crackpot!

•I do think they are important. Very Important.

•Daenerys was the first Targaryen in centuries to successfully hatch dragon eggs bringing dragons back into the world. Their presence strengthened all other sorts of magic & has abundance of use in the Great War to come than just to lay waste to armies of men & win thrones.. So the Mother of all those dragons who was reborn from the fire along with the fire made flesh of dragons isn’t “just another character in ASOIAF”

•Even after Jon being the legitimate son of the crown prince & heir apparent to the iron throne, his destiny took him to the wall. Ned let him go there even after knowing his truth. Where he learned about the white walkers, the Night King & the Great War to come. He died & came back to life surely not to be “just another character in ASOIAF”

•The amount of people who died playing the game of thrones, the likes of Robert Baratheon, Ned Stark, Tywin Lannister, Joffery Baratheon , Robb Stark, Stannis Baratheon, Margaery Tyrell, Little finger & the list goes on.. All of these are master players some of them are heroes & greatly experienced battle commanders. But they died.

•Whereas Jon & dany were well kept away from the political warfare of Westeros, at the wall & in essos respectively. They had their moments of danger, jon was killed as a matter of fact, but yet they are alive & undeniably the most powerful leaders in Westeros as of now. Specially since they are going to be allied through marriage. (*wink wink* 😉 I’ll throw in a lil early OG prediction for you) 

“Together, they’d be difficult to beat.. ”

                                                 -Lord Petyr Baelish

•Maester Aemon in the books knew about the prophecy of Azor Ahai. Initially, he thought it was Rhaegar, who inturn thought it was his son. Maester Aemon the Last Targaryen Ancestor of both Jon & Daenerys knew & supported both of them in their endeavors. He knew Viserys as well but he doesn’t talk about him much in his POV as much as he cares for Daenerys. Also it was his vote that rose Jon Snow to the ranks of Lord Commander of the Nights Watch.

 “Allow me to give my lord one last piece of counsel, the same counsel that I once gave my brother when we parted for the last time. He was three-and-thirty when the Great Council chose him to mount the Iron Throne. A man grown with sons of his own, yet in some ways still a boy. Egg had an innocence to him, a sweetness we all loved. Kill the boy within you, I told him the day I took ship for the Wall. It takes a man to rule. An Aegon, not an Egg. Kill the boy and let the man be born. You are half the age that Egg was, and your own burden is a crueler one, I fear. You will have little joy of your command, but I think you have the strength in you to do the things that must be done. Kill the boy, Jon Snow. Winter is almost upon us. Kill the boy and let the man be born.”

                                     -Maester Aemon, Jon II (AFFC) 

“No one ever looked for a girl,” he said. “It was a prince that was promised, not a princess. Rhaegar, I thought… What fools we were, who thought ourselves so wise! The error crept in from the translation. Dragons are neither male nor female, Barth saw the truth of that, but now one and now the other, as changeable as flame. The language misled us all for a thousand years. Daenerys is the one, born amidst salt and smoke. The dragons prove it.” Just talking of her seemed to make him stronger. “I must go to her. I must.”

                           -Maester Aemon, Samwell IV (ADWD) 

•Instead of going straight to Volantis melisandre made a quick stop at Dragonstone. She probably heard the growing whispers of the occupation of the castle by a Dragon Queen. Being a follower of R'hllor having a Queen that commands the fire made flesh is nothing less than an honor for her to meet & advice.

“I Believe you have a role to play, as does another… ”

                                                   -Melisandre of Asshai

•Melisandre was practically more than convinced since bringing Jon back from the dead that he is the Prince that was Promised. If it weren’t for her reccomendation dany would never have invited Jon to Dragonstone & Jon would never have decided to go there & they would never have obtained dragon glass.

“King in the North, Jon Snow..”    

“Summon Jon Snow, Let him stand before you & tell you the things that have happened to him.. ”

                                                   -Melisandre of Asshai

•While they individually had all the might & tools to take back their family homes (winterfell & kings landing) Jon & Dany still chose to do what’s right; saving all the Realms of Men from white walkers beyond the wall & abolish slavery from root & stem respectively.

“You have a good heart Jon Snow.. ”

                                -Ser Alliser Thorne

“You may cover it up & deny it but you have a gentle heart.. ”

                             -Ser Jorah Mormont 

•Jon changed the rules at castle black by allowing the wildlings to pass south of the wall unlike any Lord Commander in the known history of the Wall & Daenerys changed the rules of the existing society in essos by giving the former slaves their freedom back, like her valyrian ancestors who overthrew the old ghis slave empire.

•Tyrion is one of the most calculative, intelligent & deeply good people in Westeros. He has read a heck lot of books on the History of Rule in Westeros & understands the ruthless nature of game of thrones better than anyone. He respects both Jon & Daenerys as rulers & as human beings. He bent his knee to daenerys after understanding her worth as a leader & he vouched for Jon in front of dany as a great leader to ally with.

Tyrion, cersei, jaime, bran, arya, sansa, sam, hound, brienne, gendry, Ser Davos, missandei etc.. There are amazing array of characters that GRRM created along with J&D, every single one unique in their own way for the realism in their nature, some fault, some indifference, making them impererfectly perfect relatable humans. Whereas Jon & Daenerys first started as secondary characters but later evolved into chance heroic characters who were nurtured throughout the Books/TV Show in a God-like fashion their entire lives leading both of them to exactly where they are now. Leading Humanity in the war for Survival.

There’s more than enough proof to back why jonerys stans believe jon & dany to be pretty darn important

feel free to add more points fam..

•Whereas Jon & dany were well kept away from the political warfare of Westeros, at the wall & in essos respectively. They had their moments of danger, jon was killed as a matter of fact, but yet they are alive & undeniably the most powerful leaders in Westeros as of now. Specially since they are going to be allied through marriage. (*wink wink* 😉 I’ll throw in a lil early OG prediction for you) 

“Together, they’d be difficult to beat.. ”

                                                 -Lord Petyr Baelish

•Maester Aemon in the books knew about the prophecy of Azor Ahai. Initially, he thought it was Rhaegar, who inturn thought it was his son. Maester Aemon the Last Targaryen Ancestor of both Jon & Daenerys knew & supported both of them in their endeavors. He knew Viserys as well but he doesn’t talk about him much in his POV as much as he cares for Daenerys. Also it was his vote that rose Jon Snow to the ranks of Lord Commander of the Nights Watch.

 “Allow me to give my lord one last piece of counsel, the same counsel that I once gave my brother when we parted for the last time. He was three-and-thirty when the Great Council chose him to mount the Iron Throne. A man grown with sons of his own, yet in some ways still a boy. Egg had an innocence to him, a sweetness we all loved. Kill the boy within you, I told him the day I took ship for the Wall. It takes a man to rule. An Aegon, not an Egg. Kill the boy and let the man be born. You are half the age that Egg was, and your own burden is a crueler one, I fear. You will have little joy of your command, but I think you have the strength in you to do the things that must be done. Kill the boy, Jon Snow. Winter is almost upon us. Kill the boy and let the man be born.”

                                     -Maester Aemon, Jon II (AFFC) 

“No one ever looked for a girl,” he said. “It was a prince that was promised, not a princess. Rhaegar, I thought… What fools we were, who thought ourselves so wise! The error crept in from the translation. Dragons are neither male nor female, Barth saw the truth of that, but now one and now the other, as changeable as flame. The language misled us all for a thousand years. Daenerys is the one, born amidst salt and smoke. The dragons prove it.” Just talking of her seemed to make him stronger. “I must go to her. I must.”

                           -Maester Aemon, Samwell IV (ADWD) 

•Instead of going straight to Volantis melisandre made a quick stop at Dragonstone. She probably heard the growing whispers of the occupation of the castle by a Dragon Queen. Being a follower of R'hllor having a Queen that commands the fire made flesh is nothing less than an honor for her to meet & advice.

“I Believe you have a role to play, as does another… ”

                                                   -Melisandre of Asshai

•Melisandre was practically more than convinced since bringing Jon back from the dead that he is the Prince that was Promised. If it weren’t for her reccomendation dany would never have invited Jon to Dragonstone & Jon would never have decided to go there & they would never have obtained dragon glass.

“King in the North, Jon Snow..”    

“Summon Jon Snow, Let him stand before you & tell you the things that have happened to him.. ”

                                                   -Melisandre of Asshai

•While they individually had all the might & tools to take back their family homes (winterfell & kings landing) Jon & Dany still chose to do what’s right; saving all the Realms of Men from white walkers beyond the wall & abolish slavery from root & stem respectively.

“You have a good heart Jon Snow.. ”

                                -Ser Alliser Thorne

“You may cover it up & deny it but you have a gentle heart.. ”

                             -Ser Jorah Mormont 

•Jon changed the rules at castle black by allowing the wildlings to pass south of the wall unlike any Lord Commander in the known history of the Wall & Daenerys changed the rules of the existing society in essos by giving the former slaves their freedom back, like her valyrian ancestors who overthrew the old ghis slave empire.

•Tyrion is one of the most calculative, intelligent & deeply good people in Westeros. He has read a heck lot of books on the History of Rule in Westeros & understands the ruthless nature of game of thrones better than anyone. He respects both Jon & Daenerys as rulers & as human beings. He bent his knee to daenerys after understanding her worth as a leader & he vouched for Jon in front of dany as a great leader to ally with.

Tyrion, cersei, jaime, bran, arya, sansa, sam, hound, brienne, gendry, Ser Davos, missandei etc.. There are amazing array of characters that GRRM created along with J&D, every single one unique in their own way for the realism in their nature, some fault, some indifference, making them impererfectly perfect relatable humans. Whereas Jon & Daenerys first started as secondary characters but later evolved into chance heroic characters who were nurtured throughout the Books/TV Show in a God-like fashion their entire lives leading both of them to exactly where they are now. Leading Humanity in the war for Survival.

There’s more than enough proof to back why jonerys stans believe jon & dany to be pretty darn important

feel free to add more points fam..
